etymologies: Middle English: from Old French loche, of unknown origin

definitions: a small elongated bottom-dwelling freshwater fish with several barbels near the mouth, found in Eurasia and northwestern Africa.

notes.text: Families Cobitidae and Homalopteridae (or Balitoridae): several genera and numerous species

shortDefinitions: small elongated bottom-dwelling freshwater fish with several barbels near mouth, found in Eurasia and NW Africa
